designSystem.name: Analytics Dashboard Design System
designSystem.description: Modern, data-focused dashboard design system with clean cards, vibrant accent colors, and sophisticated data visualization

designPrinciples.clarity: Information hierarchy is paramount - key metrics are immediately scannable
designPrinciples.consistency: Uniform card-based layout creates predictable, organized interface
designPrinciples.dataFirst: Visualizations are clean and purposeful, avoiding unnecessary decoration
designPrinciples.modernMinimalism: Generous white space, subtle shadows, and restrained color palette
designPrinciples.accessibility: High contrast ratios, clear typography, and intuitive information architecture

primary.description: Main accent color for charts, highlights, and active states
primary.usage: Bar charts, progress indicators, CTAs, data points

secondary.description: Supporting colors for secondary data series and softer accents
secondary.usage: Secondary chart lines, badges, alternative data visualization

neutrals.description: Neutral palette for backgrounds, text, and subtle UI elements

semantic.description: For positive trends, success states, and growth indicators

dataVisualization.description: Specific colors for different chart types and data series

fontFamily.description: System font stack prioritizing Inter for clean, modern appearance

subtext.usage: Supporting text like '+2.5% vs. last month'

hierarchy.principle: Size contrast creates clear information hierarchy
hierarchy.pattern: Large metrics → Medium labels → Small supporting text

grid.columns: Responsive grid, typically 3 columns on desktop
grid.pattern: Card-based layout with uniform heights within rows
grid.responsive: Single column on mobile, 2 columns on tablet, 3+ on desktop

cardSizes.small: Single metric card (Sales, Orders, Avg order value)
cardSizes.large: Complex visualizations or multiple data points
cardSizes.description: Cards span 1-2 grid columns based on content complexity

card.description: Primary container for all dashboard content

metricCard.structure: Title → Large Value → Trend Indicator → Sparkline (optional)

trendIndicator.style: Small text with icon or percentage

lineChart.multiSeries: Primary line bold, secondary lines lighter/dashed

donutChart.colors: Primary blue with lighter secondary colors

legend.layout: Horizontal below chart or vertical beside

sparkline.usage: Inline trend visualization in metric cards

states.active: Pressed state with slight scale or shadow

principles.clarity: Avoid chart junk, every element serves a purpose
principles.colorMeaning: Consistent color usage across all visualizations
principles.interactivity: Tooltips and hover states reveal detail on demand

bestPractices.axisLabels: Always include units and clear labels
bestPractices.comparison: Use consistent scales when comparing metrics
bestPractices.trends: Include time period context in labels

adaptations.mobile: Single column, stacked cards, simplified charts

responsiveStrategy.chartScaling: Maintain aspect ratios, adjust label density, hide minor gridlines on mobile

accessibilityGuidelines.contrast: Minimum 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for UI elements
accessibilityGuidelines.focusStates: Visible focus rings on all interactive elements
accessibilityGuidelines.screenReaders: Proper ARIA labels for charts and complex widgets
accessibilityGuidelines.colorBlindness: Don't rely solely on color to convey information

implementationNotes.chartLibrary: Use modern library like Recharts, Chart.js, or D3
implementationNotes.iconLibrary: Lucide React or similar minimal icon set
implementationNotes.performance: Lazy load charts, virtualize long lists
implementationNotes.dataFormat: Consistent data structures for easy chart consumption
